contentrichtext.text: {{Other people2|John O'Reilly (disambiguation)}} '''John Francary O'Reilly''' (born August 4, 1941) is a [[Canada|Canadian]] politician. He represented the [[Haliburton—Kawartha Lakes—Brock]] riding for the [[Liberal Party of Canada|Liberal]] party from 1993 to 2004. He lost his job in the [[Canadian federal election, 2004|2004 election]] to the [[Conservative Party of Canada (current)|Conservative]] candidate [[Barry Devolin]]. He is now a real estate broker by profession.<ref>{{CanParlbio|ID=ea6b7b35-ae3c-4904-a4e6-bebc9e04c1b7|nolist=yes}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{Authority control|VIAF=5992772}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Oreilly, John | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Canadian politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 1951 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Oreilly, John}} [[Category:1951 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Members of the House of Commons of Canada from Ontario]] [[Category:Liberal Party of Canada MPs]] {{Liberal-Ontario-MP-stub}}
